summary: HTTP Logging API / simple data logging web app on ICP (Caffeine) with Motoko backend and a frontend that loads backend canister configuration from env.json.
architectural_notes: Frontend runtime loads backend configuration from /env.json (backend_host, backend_canister_id, project_id, ii_derivation_origin).
known_issues: Production frontend build is failing to resolve backend canister ID (RuntimeConfig cannot read backend_canister_id), despite /env.json being accessible and valid; likely requires frontend-only rebuild/redeploy.

existing_features.title: Update the frontend runtime configuration loader to correctly read the backend canister ID from the production `/env.json` format that uses `backend_canister_id` (in addition to the existing `CANISTER_ID_BACKEND` and `canisterId` keys), so the app can resolve the backend canister ID at runtime.

Align the checked-in static `frontend/public/env.json` key naming with what the runtime loader supports by including a compatible backend canister ID key (so local/static hosting doesnâ€™t default to an empty `CANISTER_ID_BACKEND`).

Perform a clean frontend-only rebuild/redeploy to production so the updated runtime config loader is included in the deployed JS bundle and the production app successfully initializes using `/env.json`.

projectName: Fix runtime config parsing of env.json and redeploy frontend so backend canister ID resolves in production
